section.title: The Pixel Info Toolbox
section.para: The Pixel Info Toolbox displays information about pixels of the topmost µ and/or ℑ displayed in the Canvas. shows the Toolbox and the Canvas.

When the mouse is clicked on the Canvas, the pixel under the mouse click is highlighted, as shown in the figure. The coordinates of the pixel are displayed in the Toolbox. A new pixel may be chosen by either clicking again on the Canvas, or by typing new coordinates into the x and y boxes in the Toolbox and clicking the Update button. Either action invokes the
command.
The Clear button resets the toolbox and un-highlights the selected pixel by invoking .

The way in which the selected pixel is highlighted in the Canvas may be changed by using the &layereditor; to alter the display methods that are assigned to the topmost µ and ℑ. It will be necessary to enable List All Layers in the Settings menu first.

The data is displayed in the Toolbox in four different sections. Data is displayed only if the Canvas contains a &layer; displaying an ℑ or µ.
The top section shows data from the topmost ℑ in the display, but only if the topmost ℑ &layer; is not obscured by a µ &layer;. It displays the name of the ℑ (actually, its path) and the RGB or HSV representation of the selected pixel's color.
The next section shows the name of the µ and the pixel groups that contain the selected pixel.
The next section shows the name of the &material; assigned to the selected pixel. If no &material;
The final section shows the orientation of the pixel. If the pixel has a &material; and that &material; has an Orientation &property;, that &property;'s orientation is displayed, as shown in the top part of . If the pixel does not have an Orientation &property;, but the µ has an orientation map, the orientation from the orientation map is displayed,The orientation is displayed whether or not the pixel's &material; contains the OrientationMap &property;. If the &material; does not contain the &property;, the OrientationMap will not actually be used. as shown in the lower part of .
At the top of the orientation information pane is a pulldown menu that changes the format in which the orientation is displayed. The orientation can be displayed in any of the formats that &oof2; understands, regardless of the format used by the orientation property or orientation map file. The orientation cannot be changed, despite the presence of sliders and input boxes in .
